issue.title: merge Autogmm and GaussianCluster
issue.body: Seems like there is enough redundant code, they are both doing something similar, and we can still get both behaviors with different options

issue.title: Update AutoGMM initialization
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look at
the contribution guidelines: https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs #371 
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.
Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->

#### What does this implement/fix? Briefly explain your changes.

- agglomerative clustering is only run once for `lower_ncomponents` to extract a set of hierarchical clustering labels from `children_` attribute of agglomerative clustering model for larger # components
- estimating `gm_params` from an agglomerative clustering label or `label_init` is not performed repeatedly for each set of GM parameters

#### Any other comments?

body:
high level pseudocode 
- run agglomerative with all options for the smallest `n_components`
   - from this we can also extract labels for the non-smallest `n_components` because of the hierarchical nature of `Agglomerative` (@tliu68 called this `_hierarchical_labels()` in her code)
- make a list of params combining GM and Agg - so gm params cross agglomerative params/models
- dispatch (possibly in parallel) to a bunch of GaussianMixtures (slightly modified with the regularization increasing stuff) and fit them initialized by Agg/kmeans
